eventbinder¶

class EventBinder¶

The EventBinder class binds the buttons to specific commands of their specific handlers. For example the forward-button ‘⏵’ is bounded to the forwards method of the provided SequenceManager.

__init__(self, plot_3d, sequence_manager)¶

Initializes the eventbinder and does trigger the register methods with the given arguments. TODO

get_button_list_bottom(self)¶

Returns the generated button list for the bottom navigation bar of the root window. The button list consists of PySimpleGUI.Button and PySimpleGUI.ButtonMenu elements.

register_view_menu_events(self, plot_3d: Plot3D)¶

The button names are bounded to the specific plot_3d view-commands by using a list of ButtonEvent elements. The Reset View button menu is also being composed here.

Parameters:

  • self (EventBinder) – non-static method

  • plot_3d – plot_3d should be the Plot3D belonging to the root window.

Returns:

List of ButtonEvents and the Reset View button menu

Return type:

PySimpleGUI.ButtonMenu, list[ButtonEvents]

register_playback_speed_events(self)¶

The button names are bounded to the dummy function (see trigger_playback_menu_events()). Also the Playback Speed button menu is also being composed here.

Parameters:

  • self (EventBinder) – non-static method

  • plot_3d – plot_3d should be the Plot3D belonging to the root window.

Returns:

List of ButtonEvents and the Reset View button menu

Return type:

PySimpleGUI.ButtonMenu, list[ButtonEvents]

Static Methods¶

static dummy()¶

static dummy function. Does nothing, but is useful for special button events that need to be handled by the instance of GeometryPlayer3D directly.

GeometryPlayer3D
